ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Demonstrates how to apply the new High Quality Rendering mode to a SciChartSurface for smooth anti-aliased lines and fills!
ExampleDefinition.Description:
SciChart for Avalonia XPF ships with [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#Renderer_Plugins.html']two rasterizer plugins[/url] which use different algorithms to render the RenderableSeries to the screen. These are:
[b]#1 The VisualXcceleratorRenderSurface[/b]: A floating point, OpenGL hardware renderer (GPU Based). Utilizes pixel shaders to offload as much computation to the GPU as possible. Produces Antialiased quality and fast rendering.
[b]#2 The XamlRenderSurface[/b]: A vector renderer which uses WPF Canvas and allows high-quality, scalable export to PNG or Vector Format.
[i]Note that some renderers are only available in the source-code editions of SciChart[/i].
